result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques Lamon Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay a fine of $30 plus costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 8-29-14. If a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Marques Lamon Murphy
Current: 18250 N CAve Creed Rd  Unit 134, Phoenix, AZ 85032 United States  (Effective: 03-21-2017)
Prior: 9304 West Fairlance Court, Milwaukee, WI 53224
RECALLED (Ct date 06/09/2014)

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to pay a fine of $30 plus costs, assessments and surcharges at the rate of $20 per month commencing 8-29-14 if a payment is more than 10 days late, a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Prescription Drug without a Valid Prescription 450.11(7)(h) an unclassified misdemeanor.
State's Wintess List and State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
State's Witness List and State's Requested Jury Instructions, filed. cmt

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense motion to suppress proceeded. Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Scott Kaiser and MPD Officer Christopher Conway. Exhibits 1, 2, and 3 received. State rests subject to rebuttal.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made.  Based on all testimony and evidence presented in court DENIED defense Motion to Suppress Evidence.  Case adjourned for Final pretrial and Jury trial. 

  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine received and filed./ds

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court.  William Berens, student, with William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant appeared and received the next court date.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.  Attorney Lockwood asks to have this case called.  Attorney is in intake today and cannot return.  State moves for an adjournment of the jury trial due to unavailability of a witness.  Court grants motion and canels the jury trial.  Defense has filed a suppression motion.  Court will address all motions at the next date.  Motions to be filed by 4-24-14; response to be filed by 5-1-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn Jury Trial received and filed./ds
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO SUPPRESS

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Kevin R. Shomin for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Pretrial scheduling order received and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Maureen A. Atwell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Case is being transferred back to br. 44.    Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 6.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case is transferred to br. 6 for entry into the DPA.  lms

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense to provide the state with additional information.    Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 44.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Hanna Kolberg for Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Christopher Conway-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marques Lamon Murphy in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 01/15/2014 @ 1:30pm
